item.description:
Hi everyone this is Rob :-)

My initial e-mail to everyone asking about interest in a ride for this Sunday drew enough interest....

So let's get out there and bike!!

This is a nice 29 mile ride through the Towns of Weston, Sudbury, and Concord.

I've been on many rides and I REALLY enjoy leading the ones where everyone feels truly welcome and is part of a group of friendly people. The rides that I've been on that I don't particularly like are the ones where people are primarily interested in just getting to the end first and we don't get a chance to really laugh and have fun. Hey...what's the point?!

So, I hope you'll join us for a fabulous day! Let's pray for sun!

We'll have a lunch stop in Concord center. When we all get back to the beginning, we can decide if people want to go for ice cream etc...

Helmet is mandatory. Water bottles and energy food highly recommended.

Directions:

From Route 128, take exit 24, Rte. 30 West. The first traffic light west of Rte. 128 is at the end of the southbound off-ramp. Travel 2.3 miles on Rte 30 west to the fifth set of traffic lights (The fourth are blinking lights, in front of a firehouse.) Turn left onto Wellesley Street. Weston High School is on the left side.


Here's the cue sheet, the route is marked with a green line on the pavement at the turns:

Ok, I admit it....I took the route from another ride I had been on earlier this season....

Here's the link....

http://www.crw.org/cg...


See you soon!

Rob
item.name: Weston, Wayland, Sudbury, Concord Ride - A chance to make new friends!
